required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Letrozole and Metronomic Capecitabine in ER-positive HER2 Negative Advanced Breast Cancer (B-001 Study)
clinical_study.official_title: Letrozole With or Without Metronomic Capecitabine in First Line Treatment of Patients With ER-positive HER2 Negative Advanced Breast Cancer: A Randomized Phase II Study.

brief_summary.textblock: A phase II clinical trial designed to test the effect of combining endocrinal therapy (Letrozole) with chemotherapy (Capecitabine) in first line treatment of advanced cases of female breast cancer with ER positive disease.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a randomized clinical trial that assigns patients with female breast cancer in the metastatic entity or advanced -beyond local disease treatment - entity into two arms. Arm A contains Letrozole with metronomic Capecitabine versus arm B that contains Letrozole alone. This is to be applied on ER positive HER2 negative tumours.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Patients are assigned into two arms of treatment, arm A contains Letrozole and metronomic Capecitabine while arm B contains Letrozole alone.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 6 months from the start of treatment
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients alive and progression-free at 6 months

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 months from the start of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of CR+PR as assessed by the investigator using RECIST 1.1 criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Adverse events rates in both groups
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 months from the start of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Rates of all grade (grade 1-4) and high grade (grade 3+4) adverse events as assessed by NCI-CTAE v4.0

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life assessment using FACIT-B questionnare
secondary_outcome.description: FACIT-B questionnare will be completed by each patient at baseline and 6 months after randomization
comparison of estimated median PFS between both groups
Time from start treatment to progression, death or treatment discontinuation from any cause
Complete response + partial response + stable disease for 6 months
Percentage of patients alive at 24 months
Time from randomization to the first chemotherapy administration

arm_group.description: Letrozole 2.5mg PO daily + Capecitabine 500mg/m2 bid PO continously

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female sex
- Age 18-70
- ECOG-PS 0-II.
- Histopathological proof of breast cancer
- ER positive (Allred score of â‰¥3 out of 8), and HER2 negative by IHC (or ISH if HER2 +2).
- Metastatic/recurrent disease as proven by CT scan, bone scan or clinical examination (for skin lesions). Biopsy of the recurrent lesions is encouraged but not mandatory.
- Either hormone sensitive setting (Denovo metastatic disease or disease progression after more than 1 year of ending adjuvant endocrine therapy) or secondary resistance to tamoxifen therapy (disease relapse after more than 2 years of starting and less than 1 year of ending adjuvant endocrine therapy, or DP of metastatic disease after more than 6 months of first line tamoxifen).
- Adequate organ function.
- Signed informed consent
Exclusion criteria:
- Inadequate organ functions.
- Disease progression while on prior aromatase inhibitor therapy.
- Primary endocrine resistance.
- Double primary cancer (history of other malignancy apart from a non melanoma skin cancer).
- Refusal to sign consent.
